entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 03 at 10:45AM AKDT until July 04 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Lightning Over Eastern Interior Today And Monday... .Red Flag Warnings for abundant lightning and extremely dry fuels is in effect through midnight tonight for zone 226 and Red Flag Warnings are now in effect through Midnight Monday night for zones 218, 219, 220, 221, 222, 223, and 224. The Red Flag Warnings may need to be extended through Tuesday night.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 7:40AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The following area, Northern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:24AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY LATE THIS HOLIDAY WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend across the Inner Channels with highs from the upper 70s into the 80s. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. At
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:56PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: As temperatures rise into the 80s through mid-week, the Taiya and other area rivers and streams are forecast to rise to bankfull conditions from rapid snowmelt in higher elevations through at least Wednesday. Hikers on the lower portion of the Chilkoot Trail should note that portions of the Chilkoot Trail could begin to inundate with water.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT TUESDAY JULY 5TH... This product is relayed from the Alaska Department of Environmental Conservation. ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION Division of Air Quality AIR QUALITY ADVISORY

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:27PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL FLAGLER COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 330 PM EDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:32AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 12:18PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, north central Lincoln, southwestern Stevens, southwestern Ferry and southeastern Okanogan Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1218 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southeast of Nespelem Community to 15 miles northwest of Davenport. Movement was northeast at 15 mph.
